############################################################$N$NThis logic monitors the HMI_Activity_Heartbeat tag, which is toggled by any screen touch. $NThe first part of the logic detects any change in this bit (both rising and falling edges) and immediately resets the 30-minute HMI_Idle_Timer.$N The next instruction runs this timer as long as it hasn$'t expired. $NIf 30 minutes of inactivity passes, the final instruction executes, moving the login screen number into the HMI_Force_Screen_Num tag, which forces the C-more panel back to the login screen.$N$N############################################################
Trigger HMI activity heartbeat from any valve command or setpoint change to reset the idle timer.
Update the $'Previous$' tag after a Bypass move time setpoint change.
Update the $'Previous$' tag after a Main move time setpoint change.
Update the $'Previous$' tag after a Siphon move time setpoint change.
Any HMI screen touch toggles the $'HMI_Activity_Heartbeat$' bit. Detect either edge to reset the idle timer.
Run the 30-minute (1,800,000 ms) HMI idle timer as long as it is not already complete.
When the idle timer expires, move the Login Screen Number (e.g., $'1$') into the force-screen tag.

############################################################$N$NVTScada Watchdog Section$N$NThis logic monitors a $'heartbeat$' tag from VTScada.$NVTScada must continuously change the value of $'VTS_Watchdog_In$'.$NIf this tag stops changing for 10 seconds, the $'VTS_Comm_Watchdog_Tmr$' will time out and set two fault bits: $N$'VTS_Comm_Fault$' (self-healing)$L and $'VTS_Comm_Fault_Latched$' (manual reset).$NThe $'PLC_Watchdog_Out$' tag is a free-running counter that VTScada$Ncan monitor as a heartbeat from the PLC.$N$N############################################################
Increment the PLC-to-SCADA heartbeat counter once per second.
Reset the heartbeat counter when it reaches its preset to allow it to loop.
If SCADA heartbeat changes, reset timer, store new value, and clear self-healing fault.
If SCADA heartbeat has NOT changed, run the 10-second watchdog timer.
If the timer expires, latch the self-healing and operator-resettable communication faults.
Reset the latched comm fault on Alarm Reset.
-- METER CHAMBER PUMP AUTO LOGIC -- When HMI is in Auto mode, the Meter Sump Pump is commanded to run when the Meter Chamber Float is high.
-- METER CHAMBER PUMP CONTROL -- The pump$'s run output is triggered by either the Auto command OR the HMI Hand mode.
-- METER SUMP LOCKOUT LATCH -- When the max run timer is done, fire a one-shot and latch the lockout.
-- METER SUMP LOCKOUT: Force HMI Radio Button to OFF state when a lockout occurs.
Run Meter Sump Lockout Timer and calculate remaining minutes for display
Manual Lockout Reset via HMI: Allows an operator to cancel an active lockout by selecting $'Off$' on the HMI. This action unlatches the lockout and resets the countdown timer.
When Pump is running start timer
-- VALVE CHAMBER PUMP AUTO LOGIC -- When HMI is in Auto mode, the Valve Sump Pump is commanded to run when the Valve Chamber Float is high.
-- VALVE CHAMBER PUMP CONTROL -- The pump$'s run output is triggered by either the Auto command OR the HMI Hand mode.
-- VALVE SUMP LOCKOUT LATCH -- When the max run timer is done, fire a one-shot (DEV_ONS[11]) and latch the lockout.
-- VALVE SUMP LOCKOUT: Force HMI Radio Button to OFF state when a lockout occurs.
Run Valve Sump Lockout Timer and calculate remaining minutes for display
Lockout Reset: Clears the lockout latch if the global Alarm_Reset is pressed or if the 1-hour ValveSump_LockedOutTime timer expires.
Manual Lockout Reset via HMI: Allows an operator to cancel an active lockout by selecting $'Off$' on the HMI. This action unlatches the lockout and resets the countdown timer.
When Pump is running start timer
-- BYPASS VALVE REMOTE MODE -- The valve is in Remote when the panel switch is not in the Open or Close position.
-- BYPASS VALVE OPEN PERMISSIVE -- A command to open is active if from the panel switch OR from a remote command when in remote mode.
-- BYPASS VALVE OPEN OUTPUT -- Energize the open output if the permissive is active and the valve is not already fully open.
-- BYPASS VALVE CLOSE PERMISSIVE -- A command to close is active if from the panel switch OR from a remote command when in remote mode.
-- BYPASS VALVE CLOSE OUTPUT -- Energize the close output if the permissive is active and the valve is not already fully closed.
##### Handle HMI vs VTS setpoint handling #####
If HMI Request the valve to move then HMI setpoint is the valve move time Preset
If VTS Request the valve to move then VTS setpoint is the valve move time Preset
Apply the selected Actual Preset (converted to milliseconds) to the Bypass Move Timer.
-- BYPASS VALVE REMOTE COMMAND TIMER -- A remote command (HMI/SCADA) moves the desired time into the timer preset and enables it.$N$NNEEDS CORRECTION
-- BYPASS VALVE REMOTE COMMAND LOGIC -- While the move timer is active, the appropriate remote command bit is energized.
100ms FREE-RUNNING CLOCK PULSE -- This timer generates a continuous pulse for position calculations.
Calculate the Bypass Valve position increment based on the full stroke time setpoint and 100ms timer pulse.
-- BYPASS VALVE POSITION CALCULATION -- This logic uses a 100ms pulse to increment or decrement a position counter while the valve is moving.
##### Handle HMI vs VTS setpoint handling #####
If HMI Request the valve to move then HMI setpoint is the valve move time Preset
If VTS Request the valve to move then VTS setpoint is the valve move time Preset
Apply the selected Actual Preset (converted to milliseconds) to the Bypass Move Timer.
Calculate the Main Valve position increment based on the full stroke time setpoint and 100ms timer pulse
##### Handle HMI vs VTS setpoint handling #####
If HMI Request the valve to move then HMI setpoint is the valve move time Preset
If VTS Request the valve to move then VTS setpoint is the valve move time Preset
Apply the selected Actual Preset (converted to milliseconds) to the Bypass Move Timer.
Calculate the Siphon Valve position increment based on the full stroke time setpoint and 100ms timer pulse
-- SIPHON VALVE STOP OPEN -- Unlatch the open permissive and remote command when the move timer is done or the fully open limit switch is hit
-- SIPHON VALVE STOP CLOSE -- Unlatch the close permissive and remote command when the move timer is done or the fully closed limit switch is hit
-- ACTIVATE COOLDOWN PERIOD -- The $'Cooldown_Active$' bit turns on as soon as the move timer is done and stays on while the $'CooldownTmr$' is running
-- RUN COOLDOWN TIMER -- As long as the $'Cooldown_Active$' bit is on, this timer will run for a duration equal to the last valve move.
-- LATCH ANTI-REPEAT INTERLOCK -- While the valve is in its cooldown period, latch the $'Cmd_Held$' bit. This bit blocks any new commands until all operator inputs are released.
-- LATCH ANTI-REPEAT INTERLOCK -- While the valve is in its cooldown period, latch the $'Cmd_Held$' bit. This bit blocks any new commands until all operator inputs are released.
-- STATE 0: IDLE -- This is the default state. When the operator presses the $'Calibrate$' button, it moves to the confirmation step.
-- STATE 5: AWAITING CONFIRMATION -- The system waits for 10 seconds for the operator to press $'Confirm$'. If confirmed, calibration begins. If not, it returns to Idle.
-- STATE 10: DRIVE TO CLOSE -- The valve is driven to the fully closed position to establish a zero-point. A safety timeout is active.
-- STATE 20: RESET AND PREPARE -- Once closed, the stroke timer and position counter are cleared before starting the open stroke.
-- STATE 30: DRIVE TO OPEN & MEASURE STROKE -- The valve is driven to the fully open position. The stroke timer measures the travel time.
-- STATE 40: CALCULATE & COMPLETE -- With the full stroke time measured, the new position increment is calculated. The $'Complete$' bit is pulsed.
-- STATE 50: CLEANUP -- Reset the In-Progress and Complete flags and return to Idle.
-- ABORT LOGIC -- The operator can abort the calibration at any active step. This will safely stop the valve and move to the aborted state.
-- STATE 98: ABORTED -- The sequence was stopped by the user. It waits for the HMI command to be released before resetting to Idle.
-- FAULT LOGIC -- If the timeout timer completes during any movement step, the sequence fails and jumps to the faulted state.
-- STATE 99: FAULTED -- The sequence has faulted. All outputs are stopped. It requires the $'Calibrate$' button to be cycled to reset.
A General Alarm can be trigger by various alarm states
Start 30-minute arming timer when door is closed and system is not in alarm.
Reset arming timer if door is opened.
Start 45-second entry delay when door is opened on an armed system.
Reset entry delay timer if door is closed.
Latch the Building Entry Alarm if the entry delay expires with no disarm event.
Unlatch $'Armed$' status if the door is closed OR the system is successfully disarmed.
Reset $'Disarmed$' latch when the door is closed.
Unlatch the Building Entry Alarm on a global alarm reset.
